summary: This document is a chain of emails from late June 2019 arranging a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It involves FBI personnel from the New York office and the Victim Services Division coordinating schedules and logistics for a briefing.

persons.context: Supervises Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs) and is copied on the email chain to coordinate the Epstein victim interview discussion call.

persons.context: FBI agent from New York office copied on the email chain regarding the Epstein victim interviews conference call.

events.title: Scheduled Epstein victim interviews conference call
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, involving FBI personnel from NY and the Victim Services Division.

events.title: SDNY meeting and ADIC case brief
events.description: Reference to a 2:00 PM meeting at the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and a 3:30 PM case brief requested by the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge), indicating high-level coordination on the Epstein case.

locations: FBI NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force
FBI, Victim Services Division Child Victim Services Unit
keyFacts: In late June 2019, the FBI was actively coordinating a multi-office conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

The coordination involved the FBI's New York office (Criminal Division, Violent Crimes Task Force) and the Victim Services Division's Child Victim Services Unit, specifically Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs).
A meeting was scheduled at the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on July 1, 2019, with a high-level case brief requested by the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) for 3:30 PM that same day.
The email chain shows logistical planning for an unclassified conference call, indicating operational security considerations for discussing the sensitive case.
